message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! It's a one-of-a-kind item that I think you'll really love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $180.
I'm interested in the product, but $180 is a bit steep for me. I was thinking more along the lines of $150.
I understand that $150 is a bit lower than what I was hoping for, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm now offering the product to you for $165.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above $150. I'd be willing to go up to $155, but that's as high as I can go.

I can see you're really interested in the product, and I appreciate your willingness to meet me at $155. I'm willing to make one more concession, so I'll meet you at $160. This is my final offer, so I hope you'll consider it.
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still a bit above $155. I'd be willing to meet you at $155, but I need to be firm on this price. Can you meet me at $155?
I understand you're firm on $155, but I'm not willing to go that low. I'll make one last offer: I'll meet you at $158. This is my final offer, and I hope you'll consider it.
I appreciate your persistence, but I'm afraid I'm not willing to go above $155. I've made it clear that's my maximum price, and I'm not willing to budge. I'd like to buy the product at $155.
I understand you're firm on $155, but I'm not willing to sell at that price. I'll make one last attempt to meet you in the middle. I'll sell the product to you for $159. This is my final offer.
I understand you're making a final offer, but I'm not willing to pay $159. I'm willing to walk away from this deal if I don't get the product at $155. That's my final offer.
